problems.title: Edit Distance (Levenshtein Distance)
problems.description:
Given two strings word1 and word2, find the minimum number of operations required to convert word1 to word2. You have the following operations permitted: 1) Insert a character, 2) Delete a character, 3) Replace a character. Print the minimum edit distance.

Input Format:
First line contains first string word1.
Second line contains second string word2.

Output Format:
Print the minimum edit distance.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
horse
ros

Sample Output
3

Sample Input
intention
execution

Sample Output
5

Explanation:
To convert "horse" to "ros": 1) horse -> rorse (replace 'h' with 'r'), 2) rorse -> rose (remove 'r'), 3) rose -> ros (remove 'e'). Total 3 operations.
problems.constraints:
0 <= length of word1 <= 500
0 <= length of word2 <= 500
hintsList: Use dynamic programming. dp[i][j] represents minimum operations to convert word1[0..i-1] to word2[0..j-1]. Consider three operations: insert, delete, replace.
